full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 122 of 236 LC3KMAX4 Parkinson - Direct 1 Q. After all of the evidence was collected, did you do one final video at the end of the search? 2 A. True. 3 Q. What was that? 4 A. I walked through showing that the police department did not damage anything, and that the house was left in substantially the same condition. 5 6 MS. COMEY: Your Honor, I think now might be an appropriate time for a lunch break, if possible. We need to deal with some of the technical issues. 7 8 THE COURT: We don't have it yet, so keep going. Maybe skip to something else. 9 10 MS. COMEY: Ms. Drescher, could we please pull up what's been marked for identification as Government Exhibit -- before we do that: 11 12 Q. Mr. Parkinson, at the end of the search on October 20, 2005, what did the Palm Beach Police Department team do with all of the evidence that had been seized? 13 A. We transported it back to headquarters. 14 Q. Is that the Palm Beach Police Department's headquarters? 15 A. It is. 16 Q. To what other law enforcement agency, if any, was that evidence later transferred? 17 A. It was all transferred to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. 18 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00018223

1 Q. After all of the evidence was collected, did you do one final video at the end of the search? 2 A. True. 3 Q. What was that? 4 A. I walked through showing that the police department did not damage anything, and that the house was left in substantially the same condition. 5 6 MS. COMEY: Your Honor, I think now might be an appropriate time for a lunch break, if possible. We need to deal with some of the technical issues. 7 8 THE COURT: We don't have it yet, so keep going. Maybe skip to something else. 9 10 MS. COMEY: Ms. Drescher, could we please pull up what's been marked for identification as Government Exhibit -- before we do that: 11 12 Q. Mr. Parkinson, at the end of the search on October 20, 2005, what did the Palm Beach Police Department team do with all of the evidence that had been seized? 13 A. We transported it back to headquarters. 14 Q. Is that the Palm Beach Police Department's headquarters? 15 A. It is. 16 Q. To what other law enforcement agency, if any, was that evidence later transferred? 17 A. It was all transferred to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. 18
